subject: Medicine
title: Sleep and the Immune System
description: A micro-lesson that makes Sleep and the Immune System usable.

hook.text: People who sleep less than six hours are four times more likely to catch a cold. Sleep is your immune shield.

buildup.text: During sleep, the immune system releases cytokinesâ€”proteins that help fight infection and inflammation.

discovery.text: Sleep also enhances T cell function and antibody production after vaccinationâ€”boosting vaccine effectiveness.

twist.text: One night of poor sleep can reduce natural killer cell activity by 70%â€”your cancer defense drops overnight.

climax.text: Chronic sleep loss creates a state of low-grade inflammation linked to heart disease, diabetes, and cancer.

punchline.text: Sleep is free medicine. Skipping it is expensive.
